SauceDemoProject.pages package¶

Submodules¶

SauceDemoProject.pages.base_page module¶

class SauceDemoProject.pages.base_page.BasePage(browser, link)¶

Bases: object

This class used as a base class for other page classes that represent specific pages on a website

click_button(method, locator)¶

Clicks the element given a By method and locator.

Parameters:

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

element_is_located(locator, timeout=5)¶

Check that an element is present on the DOM of a page.

Parameters:

  • locator – used to find the element; a tuple of ‘by’ and ‘path’

  • timeout (optional) – specified time duration before throwing a TimeoutException. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

returns the WebElement located

Return type:

selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement

element_is_present(method, locator)¶

Find an element given a By method and locator.

Parameters:

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

Returns:

True if the element is located in a page. False if the element could not be found

Return type:

bool

Raises:

  • InvalidElementStateException – if the element is in an invalid state

  • NoSuchElementException – if the element cannot be found on the page

  • WebDriverException – if an error occurs while initializing the WebDriver

element_is_visible(locator, timeout=5)¶

Check that an element is present on the DOM of a page and visible. Visibility means that the element is not only displayed but also has a height and width that is greater than 0.

Parameters:

  • locator – used to find the element; a tuple of ‘by’ and ‘path’

  • timeout (optional) – specified time duration before throwing a TimeoutException. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

it is located and visible

Return type:

selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement

elements_are_located(locator, timeout=5)¶

Check that there is at least one element, located by the locator, present on a web page.

Parameters:

  • locator – used to find the element; a tuple of ‘by’ and ‘path’

  • timeout (optional) – specified time duration before throwing a TimeoutException. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

the list of all matched WebElements

Return type:

list[selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement]

elements_are_present(method, locator)¶

Find elements given a By method and locator.

Parameters:

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

Returns:

list of found WebElement or empty if elements are not found

Return type:

list[selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement]

flatten(mylist)¶

Unpacks list of lists of elements into a single, flat list of elements

Parameters:

mylist – the list of the lists of WebElements.

Returns:

the list of WebElements.

Return type:

list[selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement]

get_property(property, method, locator)¶

Gets the given property of the element.

Parameters:

  • property – name of the property to retrieve

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

Returns:

the value of a property with the given name or None if there’s no property with that name

Return type:

str | bool | WebElement | dict

get_src(i, method, locator)¶

Extract the src attribute of an element given a By method and locator. The src attribute specifies the URL of an image or other media file.

Parameters:

  • i – extract all elements of the list of individual lines of text starting from the ith element

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

Returns:

the src of the element

Return type:

str

get_text(i, method, locator)¶

Extract a specific part of the text from the element given a By method and locator.

Parameters:

  • i – extract all elements of the list of individual lines of text starting from the ith element

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

Returns:

the text of the element

Return type:

str

get_text_elements(i, method, locator)¶

Extract the substrings of the text from the elements given a By method and locator. :param i: substring starts at the i-th character and continues to the end of the text :param method: used for locating the element on the page :param locator: used with the specified method to find the element

Returns:

the list of substring of the element’s text

Return type:

list[str]

open_page()¶

Navigates to a page given by the URL.

send_keys(value, method, locator)¶

Sends keys to an element given a By method and locator.

Parameters:

  • value – the value to send to the element

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

should_be_link(link)¶

Check that the link provided is in the current URL of the browser.

Parameters:

link – link browser

should_be_page_title(title, method, locator)¶

Check that the page has the expected title given a By method and locator.

Parameters:

  • title – page’s title

  • method – used for locating the element on the page

  • locator – used with the specified method to find the element

class SauceDemoProject.pages.base_page.Handle_Exc_Element_Decorator(browser='self', timeout=0.5, title='title', value='value', property='property', method='a', locator='b', index=0)¶

Bases: object

A decorator that handles exceptions related to element on a webpage.

__call__(func)¶

Define an inner function that wraps the original function or method.

Parameters:

func (function) – the original function or method to be decorated.

Raises:

  • NoSuchElementException – if the element cannot be found on the page

  • TimeoutException – when there is no match with at least one element even after wait time

  • NoSuchAttributeException – if the attribute of the element is not found

  • ElementNotInteractableException – if the element is not currently interactable

  • InvalidElementStateException – if the element is in an invalid state

  • StaleElementReferenceException – if the element is no longer attached to the DOM

  • WebDriverException – if an error occurs while initializing the WebDriver

class SauceDemoProject.pages.base_page.Handle_Exc_Elements_Decorator(browser='self', timeout=0.5, title='title', value='value', property='property', method='a', locator='b', index=0)¶

Bases: object

A decorator that handles exceptions related to elements on a webpage.

__call__(func)¶

Define an inner function that wraps the original function or method.

Parameters:

func (function) – the original function or method to be decorated.

Raises:

  • NoSuchElementException – if the elements are not found on the page

  • TimeoutException – when there is no match with at least one element even after wait time

  • NoSuchAttributeException – if the attribute of the elements is not found

  • ElementNotInteractableException – if the elements are not currently interactable

  • InvalidElementStateException – if the element are in an invalid state

  • StaleElementReferenceException – if the elements are no longer attached to the DOM

  • WebDriverException – if an error occurs while initializing the WebDriver

SauceDemoProject.pages.cart_page module¶

class SauceDemoProject.pages.cart_page.CartPage(browser, link)¶

Bases: BasePage

This class is used to test the functionality of the cart page of the website

Parameters:

BasePage – Contains common methods that are used by all page classes

check_privacy_link()¶

Check that the privacy link is present on the page and that it can be clicked to navigate to the privacy policy page.

check_product_name_in_cart(item_name)¶

Check the name of a specific product in the cart.

Parameters:

item_name – expected product

check_the_item_price_in_cart(item_name, item_price)¶

Check the price of a specific product in the cart.

Parameters:

  • item_name – expected product

  • item_price – expected price

check_the_item_quantity_in_cart(item_name, item_qty)¶

Check the quantity of a specific product in the cart.

Parameters:

  • item_name – expected product

  • item_qty – expected quantity

check_the_quantity()¶

Check the quantity of items in the cart

clear_cart()¶

Find all of the “REMOVE” buttons on the cart page and then clicks on them one by one in the cart.

click_all_items()¶

Check that the “All items” link is present and visible on the current page and that it can be the clicked in the hamburger menu on the current page.

go_to_checkout_1_page()¶

Navigate to the first checkout page.

open_hamburger()¶

Open the hamburger menu on the current page.

should_be_btn_to_checkout_1_page()¶

Check that the checkout button is present and visible on the current page.

should_be_cart_page()¶

Check that the current page is the cart page.

Parameters:

  • username – username user

  • password – password user

SauceDemoProject.pages.product_page module¶

class SauceDemoProject.pages.product_page.ProductPage(browser, link)¶

Bases: BasePage

This class is used to test the functionality of the product page of the website.

Parameters:

BasePage – Contains common methods that are used by all page classes

check_product_img(mydict)¶

Check that the image displayed for the selected product matches the expected image.

Parameters:

mydict (dict) – dictionary of selected product, including the expected image URL

check_product_name(mydict)¶

Check that the name displayed for the selected product matches the expected name.

Parameters:

mydict (dict) – dictionary of selected product, including the expected name.

check_product_price(mydict)¶

Check that the price displayed for the selected product matches the expected price.

Parameters:

mydict (dict) – dictionary of selected product, including the expected price.

should_be_product_page()¶

Check that the current page is the product page.

SauceDemoProject.pages.products_page module¶

class SauceDemoProject.pages.products_page.ProductsPage(browser, link)¶

Bases: BasePage

This class is used to test the functionality of the products page of the website.

Parameters:

BasePage – Contains common methods that are used by all page classes

add_item_on_products_page(*args, **kwargs)¶

Add items to the cart or remove items from cart by name.

Returns:

list of the selected items by name

Return type:

list[selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement]

check_privacy_link()¶

Check that the privacy link is present on the page and that it can be clicked to navigate to the privacy policy page.

find_button(el)¶

Find and click the button “ADD TO CART”/”REMOVE” of selected element on the products page.

Parameters:

selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement – selected item

go_to_basket_page()¶

Navigate to the cart page.

go_to_product_page()¶

Navigate to the selected product page.

list_finded_item_by_name(item_names)¶

Returns a list of products on the products page that match the item_names.

Parameters:

item_names – names of the products

Returns:

the list of items

Return type:

list[selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement]

select_product()¶

Retrieve the information about a product on the products page.

Returns:

dictionary containing information about a product on the products page

Return type:

dict

Check the cart is empty.

should_be_link_to_cart_page()¶

Check the shopping cart link is visible on the page.

should_be_products_page()¶

Check that the current page is the products page.

should_be_products_page_inventory_list()¶

Checks products in an inventory list on the page.

sorting_products_by_name_asc()¶

Sort a list of products by name in ascending order and check the sorting.

sorting_products_by_price_asc()¶

Sorts a list of products by price in ascending order and check the sorting.
